channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meet the 102-year-old healthy-living pioneer who was espousing ‘wellness’ long before it was a trend
item.description: The founder of the famed Rancho la Puerta resort says that not worrying is more important than what kind of water you drink.

item.title: Families of Uvalde school shooting victims sue Meta, Microsoft, gunmaker
item.description: The Uvalde suit argues that Daniel Defense used Instagram and Activision's Call of Duty to market to teenage boys, while Meta and Microsoft allowed it.

item.title: GameStop shares soar on completion of $933 million stock sale after meme frenzy
Families of slain Uvalde victims sue Meta, 'Call of Duty' maker, and gun manufacturer: 'This three-headed monster knowingly exposed him to the weapon'
item.description: “There is a direct line between the conduct of these companies and the Uvalde shooting,” said Josh Koskoff, an attorney for the families.

item.title: Truth Social struggles to grow its U.S. user base, new data on Trump Media app shows
item.description: Trump Media, which trades under DJT on the Nasdaq, relies on ad sales and acknowledges that a decline in user engagement could hurt its business.

item.title: Buoyed by Nvidia earnings, Wall Street holds hope for a 'Goldilocks scenario'
A law firm tried to blame a 9-year-old girl for not noticing an iPhone camera a former American Airlines flight attendant secretly taped to a toilet seat
item.description: A former American Airlines attendant is accused of luring girls to use the lavatory after taping his iPhone to the toilet seat and explaining that the seat was broken.

item.title: UAW challenges Mercedes-Benz union vote, asks NLRB for new election
item.description: The UAW alleges Mercedes-Benz fired pro-union workers, forced workers to attend anti-union meetings, and interfered with workers' ability to advocate.

item.title: How Morgan Spurlock and ‘Super Size Me’ changed our view of fast food
CEO at $14 billion electronics firm can’t talk about his resignation following an internal investigation
item.description: The former exec can only say “no comment” in response to queries, according to restrictive covenants with an unusual provision.

item.title: Two CVS retail stores in Rhode Island join new national pharmacy union
item.description: The votes at the CVS stores signal growing momentum in a movement to help thousands of U.S. pharmacy workers address what they call unsafe working conditions.

item.title: Nasdaq leads U.S. stocks higher Friday, though Dow snaps 5-week win streak
Front-end developers: These are the states where you’ll find the highest average salaries
item.description: Front-end developers work on the visual aspect of websites, and can earn relatively high annual salaries. The states where they’re paid the most, though, may surprise you.

item.title: Here's where BlackRock's bond guru Rick Rieder sees opportunity right now
item.description: In this market, investors can grab some great yields and not have to take any big risks to get them, said BlackRock global fixed income CIO Rick Rieder.

item.title: Housing has raised the cost of living — but higher rates aren’t the culprit
